messages.title: Who am I?
messages.content:
Born and raised in the valleys, I have lived in Kenfig Hill for 11 years with my wife Lorraine and three children.
I trained in the rail and construction industries.
Now I work as a construction site manager on various rail projects throughout the UK.
I am also part of a charity where we have worked on charitable construction projects around Europe.
I joined Plaid Cymru in order to make a difference. Plaid Cymru is the only party that puts the interest of Wales and its people first.

messages.title: Rhys says:
messages.content:
"I am delighted to be standing in my home town of Bridgend, as the Plaid Cymru Candidate. I am privileged to have the opportunity to give Bridgend a voice in Westminster."
"Wales needs a strong voice in Westminster, and someone who will stand up to the Conservative government."
"In these uncertain times, Wales needs to secure its future, for every child in Wales, living in poverty."

keyPolicies.policyDescription:
Plaid Cymru has comprehensive plans to cut waiting times within the Welsh NHS, which include:
- Building three new diagnostic centres to free up bottlenecks in the system so people can start treatment earlier.
- Recruiting 1000 extra doctors to increase the capacity of the Welsh NHS.
- Integrating health & social care to secure a fairer, more efficient system.

Safeguard the interests of Wales and its people throughout the Brexit negotiations. Make Wales more attractive place in the UK for businesses. Develop a modern economy. Ensure older citizens maintain their independence and are properly supported. Develop a sustainable environment.

issues.brexitEurope: Safeguard the interests of Wales and its people throughout the Brexit negotiations.
issues.economy: Make Wales the most attractive place in the UK for businesses, and build up a vibrant economy.
issues.environment: Develop a more sustainable environment and reduce pollution.
issues.health: Plaid Cymru has comprehensive plans to cut waiting times within the Welsh NHS.
issues.labourEmployment: Provide opportunities to help young people be successful in highly skilled, responsible citizens.
issues.socialWelfare: Ensure older citizens maintain their independence and are properly supported.

community.content: Support local public services so they can be properly financed.
